title: Sidus Space could launch LizzieSat-1 without thrusters
summary: Sidus Space could launch LizzieSat-1 without thrusters if it can’t get safety clearances in time to deploy its first satellite from the International Space Station early next year.

title: Starlink Group 4-26 slated for Tuesday launch from LC-39A
summary: On August 9 at 6:57 PM EDT (22:57 UTC), SpaceX’s Falcon 9 rocket will lift off from pad 39A at the Kennedy Space Center, carrying 52 Starlink satellites to Low Earth Orbit (LEO). These satellites will contribute to filling up the fourth shell of the Starlink constellation, which is now available in 36 countries to provide internet access to people around the globe.

title: Aerospace develops lost-cost optical ground network
summary: The Aerospace Corp. is establishing a network of remotely operated optical communications terminals to support existing and future small satellite missions.

title: China’s secretive space plane flies higher and longer than before
summary: So what is it doing up there? Secret, space-y stuff, of course.

title: SpaceX sees continued strong demand for rideshare missions
summary: SpaceX, whose rideshare services have reshaped the smallsat launch market, says it continues to see strong demand with missions booked into 2025.

title: Telespazio unveils product line for NewSpace market
summary: Telespazio is beginning to offer a family of products to help commercial space companies set up a digitized ground segment in the cloud.

title: Atlas Space Operations upgrades user interface to ease scheduling
summary: Atlas Space Operations upgraded its user interface to make it easier for customers to schedule communications with their satellites and to quickly confirm whether data was transmitted.

title: Download your Tuesday ‘News from the 2022 Small Satellite show’ digital edition
summary: The SpaceNews editorial team is producing a daily for the 2022 Small Satellite show, a nightly email newsletter and all-day web coverage during the 2022 Small Satellite show in Logan, Utah the week of August 9.

title: Terran Orbital prioritizes work on SDA smallsats over PredaSAR
summary: Small satellite manufacturer Terran Orbital reported increased revenues Aug. 9 as it ramps up work on satellites for the Space Development Agency, but is planning to sell stock as its cash reserves decline.

title: Starlink satellites encounter Russian ASAT debris squalls
summary: Debris from a Russian antisatellite weapon demonstration that caused “squalls” of close approaches to satellites earlier this year is now affecting a new series of Starlink satellites.
